title: Ticket #7353: condor_submit fails for remote schedds that map to another Owner
description:
In 8.8, condor_submit -remote fails when the remote schedd maps to a different user than the user they're submitting as from the client host. CERN was bit by this when one of their clients updated from 8.6 to 8.8: 

[bejones@batchman04 condor]$ condor_submit -pool condorce02.cern.ch:9619 -remote condorce02.cern.ch -spool grid.sub
Submitting job(s).
ERROR: Failed to commit job submission into the queue.


Logs on the CE say this:

10/21/19 15:51:05 (D_ALWAYS) SetAttribute security violation: setting owner to "bejones" when active owner is "dteam005"

The above submission works if the submitter sets +Owner = undefined.
remarks:
2019-Oct-31 14:31:14 by johnkn:
This is a bug that crept in when we made the python bindings use the same utility library as condor_submit. We can fix condor_submit so that it has a special case for -remote, but there is no way to do this with the python binding submit. users of the bindings will still have to use +Owner=undefined

2019-Dec-17 10:45:41 by jfrey:
Code Review

Looks good.
